intro: Cerefolium trichospermum, commonly known as the silky filaree, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by distinctive, triangular seed pods. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered with fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft appearance. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
